abstracts.cdata!:
This document summarizes progress in the
            execution of the reform program, and actions taken by the
            Government of Turkey, to meet the specific conditions for
            the release of the second tranche of the Agricultural Reform
            Implementation Project (ARIP). It reviews recent economic
            developments, and progress of the project against the
            release criteria, i.e., a satisfactory macroeconomic
            framework, and substantial agriculture sector reform,
            namely, reducing the fiscal outlays on agricultural
            subsidies, facilitated by greater market deregulation
            through reduction, and phasing out of state-set prices, and
            reduced intervention purchases financed by the budget, while
            in the grains sector, the Turkish Grain Board (TMO) reduced
            its volume of intervention purchases. In the area of reform,
            and privatization of SEES, the Government transferred all
            state-owned sugar factories (SEKER) under the scope of the
            privatization program, and the state tobacco company (TEKEL)
            was included in the Privatization Administration's
            portfolio. A substantial number of farmers in the 2003
            Direct Income Support (DIS) Program, have been registered in
            the National Registry of Farmers (NRF), meeting the tranche
            release condition by a wide margin. In view of the overall
            performance and progress described above, and in compliance
            with the specific conditions of release of the second
            tranche, availability of the adjustment portion of the Loan
            has been informed, in the amount o f US$ lOO million.
